Detailed Description

Helper functions for PKI.

int __cvmx_helper_pki_global_setup ( int  node  ) 
int __cvmx_helper_pki_install_dflt_vlan ( int  node  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

This function installs the default VLAN entries to identify the VLAN and set WQE[vv], WQE[vs] if VLAN is found. In 78XX hardware (PKI) is not hardwired to recognize any 802.1Q VLAN Ethertypes

Parameters:
node node number

int  xipd_port 
)

int cvmx_helper_pki_map_aura_chl_bpid ( int  node,
uint16_t  aura,
uint16_t  bpid,
uint16_t  chl_map[],
uint16_t  chl_cnt 
)

This function maps specified bpid to all the auras from which it can receive bp and then maps that bpid to all the channels, that bpid can asserrt bp on.

Parameters:
node node number.
aura aura number which will back pressure specified bpid.
bpid bpid to map.
chl_map array of channels to map to that bpid.
chl_cnt number of channel/ports to map to that bpid.
Returns:
Zero on success. Negative on failure
void cvmx_helper_pki_modify_prtgrp ( int  xipd_port,
int  grp_ok,
int  grp_bad 
)

This function modifies the sso group where packets from specified port needs to be routed.

Parameters:
ipd_port pki port number.
grp_ok sso group where good packets are routed
grp_bad sso group where errored packets are routed NOTE: This function assumes that each port has its own style/profile and is not using qpg qos

int cvmx_helper_pki_port_shutdown ( int  ipd_port  ) 

This function frees up PKI resources consumed by that port.

This function should only be called if port resources (fpa pools aura, style qpg entry pcam entry etc.) are not shared

Parameters:
xipd_port ipd port number for which resources need to be freed.

This function should only be called if port resources (fpa pools aura, style qpg entry pcam entry etc.) are not shared

Parameters:
ipd_port ipd port number for which resources need to be freed.
int cvmx_helper_pki_route_dmac ( int  node,
int  style,
uint64_t  mac_addr,
uint64_t  mac_addr_mask,
int  final_style 
)

This function send the packets to specified style/profile if specified mac address and specified input style/profile matches.

Parameters:
node node number.
style style/profile to match against
mac_addr mac address to match
mac_addr_mask mask of mac address bits 1: exact match 0: don't care ex: to exactly match mac address 0x0a0203040506 mask = 0xffffffffffff to match only first 2 bytes 0x0a02xxxxxxxx mask = 0xffff00000000
final_style final style (contains aura/sso_grp etc) to route matched packet to.
int cvmx_helper_pki_route_prt_dmac ( int  xipd_port,
uint64_t  mac_addr,
uint64_t  mac_addr_mask,
int  grp 
)

This function send the packets to specified sso group if specified mac address and specified input port matches.

NOTE: This function will always create a new style/profile for the specified sso group even if style/profile already exist and if the style used by this ipd port is shared all the ports using that style will get affected. similar function to use: cvmx_helper_pki_route_dmac()

Parameters:
node node number.
ipd_port ipd port on which mac address match needs to be performed.
mac_addr mac address to match
mac_addr_mask mask of mac address bits 1: exact match 0: don't care ex: to exactly match mac address 0x0a0203040506 mask = 0xffffffffffff to match only first 2 bytes 0x0a02xxxxxxxx mask = 0xffff00000000
grp sso group to route matched packet to.
Returns:
success: final style containing routed sso group fail: -1

This function sets up all the ports of particular interface for chosen fcs mode.

(only use for backward compatibility). New application can control it via init_interface calls.

Parameters:
node node number.
interface interface number.
nports number of ports
has_fcs 1 -- enable fcs check and fcs strip. 0 -- disable fcs check.

void cvmx_helper_pki_set_little_endian ( int  node  ) 

This function sets the Packet mode of all ports and styles to little-endian.

It Changes write operations of packet data to L2C to be in little-endian. Does not change the WQE header format, which is properly endian neutral.

Parameters:
node node number.
int cvmx_helper_pki_set_qpg_entry ( int  node,
struct cvmx_pki_qpg_config *  qpg_cfg 
)

This function setups the qos table by allocating qpg entry and writing the provided parameters to that entry (offset).

Parameters:
node node number.
qpg_cfg pointer to struct containing qpg configuration
void cvmx_helper_pki_set_wqe_mode ( int  node,
bool  pkt_outside_wqe 
)

This function sets the wqe buffer mode of all ports.

First packet data buffer can reside either in same buffer as wqe OR it can go in separate buffer. If used the later mode, make sure software allocate enough buffers to now have wqe separate from packet data.

Parameters:
node node number.
pkt_outside_wqe 0 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] immediately followed by packet data, in the same buffer as the work queue entry. 1 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] in a new buffer separate from the work queue entry. Words following the WQE in the same cache line will be zeroed, other lines in the buffer will not be modified and will retain stale data (from the buffer’s previous use). This setting may decrease the peak PKI performance by up to half on small packets.
void cvmx_helper_pki_show_port_config ( int  xipd_port  ) 

This function displays all the PKI parameters related to that particular port.

Parameters:
xipd_port ipd port number to display parameter of

This function shuts down complete PKI hardware and software resources.

node node number where PKI needs to shutdown.
int cvmx_helper_setup_aura_qos ( int  node,
int  aura,
bool  ena_red,
bool  ena_drop,
uint64_t  pass_thresh,
uint64_t  drop_thresh,
bool  ena_bp,
uint64_t  bp_thresh 
)

This function sets up aura QOS for RED, backpressure and tail-drop.

Parameters:
node node number.
aura aura to configure.
ena_red enable RED based on [DROP] and [PASS] levels 1: enable 0:disable
pass_thresh pass threshold for RED.
drop_thresh drop threshold for RED
ena_bp enable backpressure based on [BP] level. 1:enable 0:disable
bp_thresh backpressure threshold.
ena_drop enable tail drop. 1:enable 0:disable
Returns:
Zero on success. Negative on failure
Parameters:
node node number.
aura aura to configure.
ena_red enable RED based on [DROP] and [PASS] levels 1: enable 0:disable
pass_thresh pass threshold for RED.
drop_thresh drop threshold for RED
ena_bp enable backpressure based on [BP] level. 1:enable 0:disable
bp_thresh backpressure threshold.
ena_drop enable tail drop. 1:enable 0:disable
Returns:
Zero on success. Negative on failure
Note:
the 'node' and 'aura' arguments may be combined in the future to use a compaund cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t structure argument.

void cvmx_pki_set_max_frm_len ( int  ipd_port,
uint32_t  max_size 
)

Modifies maximum frame length to check.

It modifies the global frame length set used by this port, any other port using the same set will get affected too.

Parameters:
xipd_port ipd port for which to modify max len.
max_size maximum frame length
